chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Otis A Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
03-22-2016/ Judge Michelle A Havas
The Court ordered restitution in the amount of $726.74, payable to Jerome P., to be paid during the period of Probation.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges and/ or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in a civil judgment.

Restitution hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.

-No contact with firearms.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
Upon successful completion of all terms of probation, Court will consider motion for expungement.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.

-AODA and recommended treatment.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.

timeConds.notes: -Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 6-10-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis A Burns in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Reflects 03-22-2016 Court order for restitution

Defendant Otis A Burns in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Sworn for the state: Jerome P.  Exhibits 1 and 2 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for defense: Otis Burns.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court ordered restitution in the amount of $726.74 payable to Jerome P. to be paid during the period of probation.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.

Defendant Otis A Burns in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court lifts stayed bench warrant.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 1 as Amended:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.  The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 6-10-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
-Perform 40 hours of community service.

Upon successful completion of all terms of probation, Court will consider motion for expungement.

Defense requests a restitution hearing date. 

filed: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  

Restitution hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court.  Dax Odom for Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant failing to appear due to flat tire.  Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1 as Amended:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.

Defendant Otis A Burns in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  

Pursuant o plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Count 1 amended to  Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.62(1)(a), 973.055(1), a Misdemeanor.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Otis A Burns in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains in trial posture for 2-15-2016.  All parties are notified that effective January 30, 2016 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackermann-Havas, Branch 45,  in Room 504 Courthouse.

Defendant Otis A Burns in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is hoping to resolve as a DPA and will contact ADA Tempelis.    Case set for final pretrial on 1-22-2016 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 2-15-2016 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Per Commissioner Sweet: Due to the defendant residing in Racine and going out of the country until 12/7/15 next court date is scheduled in the afternoon after Dec. 7
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 12/15/15 at 1:15pm, Branch 38.

Defendant Otis A Burns in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
No reply from defendant or surety.  sb
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Court orders all cash bail on deposit forfeited.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JCP (DOB 12/3/1989) and La Cage.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. Court ordered if bail was forfeited, it is to be reinstated.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Otis A Burns in court.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 38  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
